required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Application of Thrombin Gel Matrix for the Prevention of Lymphocele in Patients With Endometrial Cancer.
clinical_study.official_title: Application of Thrombin Gel Matrix for the Prevention of Lymphocele in Patients With Endometrial Cancer.

brief_summary.textblock: To compare the incidence of lymphocele in Endometrial cancer patients with thrombin gel matrix used and not used during pelvic lymph node dissection.

detailed_description.textblock: Pelvic lymph node dissection is the most accurate staging tool to determine lymph node involvement in endometrial cancer. Lymphoceles developed after surgery can cause serious morbidity, additional costs and delays in chemotherapy or radiotherapy. In this study, conventional pelvic lymphadenectomy will be compared with thrombin gel matrix application after pelvic lymphadenectomy. Our goal is to prospectively assess the lymphostatic effect of thrombin gel matrix in endometrial cancer patients undergoing pelvic lymph node dissection.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Application of Thrombin gel matrix after Pelvic lymphadenectomy. And compare this application with Conventional Pelvic Lymphadenectomy.

primary_outcome.description: Frequency pelvic lymphocele at post-operative 2th month

secondary_outcome.description: Volume of lymphocele detected with radiographic imagining at post-operative 2th month (the two largest dimensions measured in centimetres)

arm_group.description: Thrombin gel matrix applicated after conventional pelvic lymphadenectomy

intervention.description: Thrombin gel Matrix applied on pelvic lymphadenectomy areas after lympadenectomy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Endometrial cancer patients who need laparotomic bilateral PLND
- Patients suitable for surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous pelvic surgery
- Previous Chemotherapy or Radiotherapy
- Patients who undergo only lymph node sampling
- Patients who have not signed Informed Consent

reference.citation: Kim YH, Shin HJ, Ju W, Kim SC. Prevention of lymphocele by using gelatin-thrombin matrix as a tissue sealant after pelvic lymphadenectomy in patients with gynecologic cancers: a prospective randomized controlled study. J Gynecol Oncol. 2017 May;28(3):e37. doi: 10.3802/jgo.2017.28.e37. Epub 2017 Feb 28.
